definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to fly
to dance/to wield/to brandish
(of snow etc) to fill the sky

sentences.english: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我的花园里飞舞着很多蝴蝶，我几乎看不见花了。

sentences.english: Danced in the wind that's you.
It's snowing out of shopwindow, snow flakes dancing in the air.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗外正在下着雪，雪花在空中飞舞。

sentences.english: Jiang dipped and danced, delighting her teammates and the arena.
sentences.chinese: 江钰源轻轻的飞舞，队员们和现场观众满脸堆笑。

sentences.english: At first, they sing and dance, like butterflies among flowers.
sentences.chinese: 开始时，边唱边舞，表现蝴蝶飞舞于花丛之中。

sentences.english: When the bees busy dancing in the flowers, the adults are busy in the land.
sentences.chinese: 当蜜蜂飞舞在花间忙碌时，大人也在土地里忙个不停。

sentences.english: Sent a bumper grain harvest in the autumn, dancing snowflakes in winter has finally arrived.
sentences.chinese: 送走了五谷丰登的秋天，雪花飞舞的冬天终于来临了。

sentences.english: The air was thick with butterflies, lifting, fluttering, settling.
sentences.chinese: 空中满是翩翩飞舞，忽上忽下的各种彩蝶。

sentences.english: Sometimes the notes would dance off the page becoming faster and faster and more effervescent.
sentences.chinese: 有时，音符会离开纸页，变得越来越快，甚至飞舞。

sentences.english: Fireflies fly everywhere on summer nights, which attract children to chase after them.
sentences.chinese: 夏日的夜晚，流萤飞舞，惹得孩子们争着抓扑。

sentences.english: So leisurely, she danced all over the sky.
sentences.chinese: 那么的闲逸，她，漫天飞舞。

sentences.english: You are seeing cinders dancing in the updraft.
sentences.chinese: 你还看到漫天飞舞的火灰在扶摇直上。

sentences.english: None of the buildings is equipped with air conditioning, and the air is filled with midges and mosquitoes in swarms of biblical proportions.
sentences.chinese: 没有一栋房屋内装有空调，空中成群的蚊子飞舞。

sentences.english: Willow catkins are fluttering in the air.
the moths are flying around the light poles.
I was fascinated in the scene of the dance of the falling flowers.
sentences.chinese: 一时陶醉在这落花飞舞的情节中。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to float/to drift
whole sky
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to curl up/to linger on (sound)
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
suave/graceful/fluent and elegant (calligraphy)
(to start) dancing lightly and gracefully
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to curl up/to wind around
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
